com.bigdata.training.cassandra
Class SpeakCassandra

java.lang.Object
  com.bigdata.training.cassandra.SpeakCassandra

public class SpeakCassandra
extends java.lang.Object

Main class for cassandra interactions loads lines from a book as messages into cassandra database and via a swing application demonstrates the capability of cassandra to fetch records in a chronologically sorted fashion

Author:
ameet

 void persistConversationsToComp(java.lang.String columnFamily, java.lang.String chatScript, int limit)
          takes a file and persists it to specified CF with requested # of lines This method uses a composite Type column family the definition is: create column family chat_conversation_comp with column_type = 'Standard' and comparator = 'CompositeType(TimeUUIDType,UTF8Type)' and default_validation_class = 'UTF8Type' and key_validation_class = 'UTF8Type'

startColumn

private byte[] startColumn
record as checkpoint the start column to be used in slice range to be used in the slice predicate. This will be updated by every call of getNext()

deleteColumnFamily

public void deleteColumnFamily(java.lang.String columnFamily)

Parameters:

persistConversationsToComp

public void persistConversationsToComp(java.lang.String columnFamily,
                                       java.lang.String chatScript,
                                       int limit)
takes a file and persists it to specified CF with requested # of lines This method uses a composite Type column family the definition is: create column family chat_conversation_comp with column_type = 'Standard' and comparator = 'CompositeType(TimeUUIDType,UTF8Type)' and default_validation_class = 'UTF8Type' and key_validation_class = 'UTF8Type'

Parameters:
columnFamily -
chatScript - the file containing the conversations.
limit - how many rows to write

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
1. create an instance of SpeakCassandra for a particular KeySpace 2. drop and recreate column family 3. persist data to composite CF 4. read data from composite CF
